item.title: Ethernet over Copper FAQ - Part 2
item.description:
Ethernet over Copper (EoC) is gaining traction as a business connectivity solution, rivaling traditional options like T1, DS3, and OC3. To determine if EoC is a good fit for your business, consider these frequently asked questions. Q: How does EoC’s cost compare to other services? A: EoC often provides significant cost savings compared to other business bandwidth services. A 3 Mbps Ethernet connection might be priced similarly to a 1.5 Mbps T1 line, with even greater savings at higher bandwidths...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-over-copper-faq-part-2/

item.title: 100 x 100 Mbps Business Bandwidth Options
item.description:
For many businesses, 100 Mbps bandwidth is no longer optional. This level is necessary for essential functions like remote backups, cloud-based applications, content distribution, and large file sharing (e.g., high-resolution medical images). Older technologies like T1 or DS3 connections are inadequate. So, what options are available and affordable? OC-3 SONET fiber optic bandwidth is a traditional service offering this capacity, used by large companies for decades. However, high costs previously limited its wider adoption...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/100-x-100-mbps-business-bandwidth-options/
